posts.post_content: I would like to say that he's not too great and is just an overrated fatty, but he's actually pretty good. He's so big he's probably not going to die, and his arrival promises a hold on any removal. So all your opponant can hope to do is draw a way to get rid of him, kill him with a bigger creature (like that's going to happen) or chump block. Otherwise your opponant is taking 8 damage a turn.
posts.html:

Some people are getting it wrong. Put into play ( [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper) ) isn't 'play from your hand'. On the other hand [Maelstorm Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstorm Archangel) wording does allow you to do so.

posts.post_content: I use this in my "Bring out your dead!" deck. I cast [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive) to get it into graveyard then [Zombify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombify) to bring it out. You don't get his other benefits, but it is nice to have an 8/8 flyer by turn 4 or 5! I also have [Doomed Necromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomed Necromancer) to bring out other big nasty monsters. Might throw Bloodchief in eventually. :)

posts.post_content: [Dream Halls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dream Halls) anyone? Casting it from your hand for {0} is still casting it. Sadly, you need blue for both, but at least it's an ally color.

Posted By: Ideatog (11/8/2011 5:17:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
By the time you can hardcast him -- barring an extremely lucky series of [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)s -- your opponent won't *have* a hand for you to remove (except maybe an instant, which he will immediately cast before Hypnox's ability resolves). 90% of the time, this guy's ability might as well not even exist. He's pretty good if you reanimate him -- an 8/8 flier immune to [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) -- but there are better options in reanimator, too.  
  
Extremely badass art, though. For that, I give him 3/5 stars.
posts.html:
By the time you can hardcast him -- barring an extremely lucky series of Dark Rituals -- your opponent won't have a hand for you to remove (except maybe an instant, which he will immediately cast before Hypnox's ability resolves). 90% of the time, this guy's ability might as well not even exist. He's pretty good if you reanimate him -- an 8/8 flier immune to Doom Blade -- but there are better options in reanimator, too.

Extremely badass art, though. For that, I give him 3/5 stars.
